description.narrative: 1. Increased access to microlending: The Project will help increase access to microfinance borrowers in the low-income states of India and in rural areas. 2. Market Creation: Resilience: IFC anticipates that the Project will support resilience among microfinance institutions in the market by bringing comfort to other local and international investors and catalyzing new and longer-term funding to the sector. By investing in CAGL, IFC will demonstrate to other investors the viability of supporting the sustainability and recovery of the bottom of pyramid lenders in the market.

The proposed investment comprises a 3-year senior loan of up to US$50 million to CreditAccess Grameen Limited (CAGL or the Company), which is Reserve Bank of India (RBI) registered, non-banking finance company microfinance institution (NBFC-MFI). It currently operates in 14 Indian states and 1 union territory through 1,635 branches and has a borrower base of 3.8 million women borrowers. On a consolidated basis, CAGL is the largest NBFC-MFI in India with a gross loan portfolio of US$2.2 billion and a net worth of US$543 million as on March 31, 2022. The proceeds of IFC loan will be utilized towards expanding the Companys portfolio to women borrowers for income generation purposes, specifically in the low-income states (LIS)/rural areas of India.
